item.title: Saviynt Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Saviynt Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsFebruary 25, 2025Saviynt Inc.is now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities discovered in Saviynt products or vulnerabilities reported to Saviynt Labs that are not in another CNA’s scope. Read theSaviynt press release.

item.title: CPAN Security Group Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: CPAN Security Group Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsFebruary 25, 2025CPAN Security Groupis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities in Perl and CPAN Modules (including End-of-Life Perl versions) found athttps://perl.org,https://cpan.org, orhttps://metacpan.org/, excluding distributions of Perl or CPAN Modules maintained by third-party redistributors.

item.title: Red Hat Adds a CNA of Last Resort (CNA-LR) to its Root Hierarchy
item.description: Red Hat Adds a CNA of Last Resort (CNA-LR) to its Root HierarchyblogBy CVE Program|February 25, 2025TheCVE Programis pleased to announce that theRed Hat Roothas now established a “CVE Numbering Authority of Last Resort (CNA-LR)” to assignCVE Identifiers (CVE IDs)and to publish correspondingCVE Recordsfor vulnerabilities in software developed by aCNAwithin the Red Hat Root hierarchy. As a Root, “Red Hat’s scope includes the open source community. Any open source organizations that prefer Red Hat as their Root; organizations are free to choose another Root if it suits them better.”

item.title: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on February 5 Now Available
item.description: Minutes from CVE Board Teleconference Meeting on February 5 Now AvailablenewsMarch 4, 2025TheCVE Boardheld a teleconference meeting on February 5, 2025. Read themeeting minutes summary.

item.title: Please Complete Our “CVE Data Usage and Satisfaction Survey” by April 4, 2025
item.description: Please Complete Our “CVE Data Usage and Satisfaction Survey” by April 4, 2025blogBy CVE Program|March 4, 2025TheCVE Programis continuously investigating new methods and offerings that will better inform the overall community regarding publicly disclosed vulnerabilities. To that end, we would greatly appreciate your feedback to our “CVE Data Usage and Satisfaction Survey.” The survey opens today and will close at 11:59 PM ET on April 4, 2025.

item.title: Full Agenda Now Available forCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2025on April 7-10, 2025!
item.description: Full Agenda Now Available forCVE/FIRST VulnCon 2025on April 7-10, 2025!blogBy CVE Program|March 11, 2025VulnCon 2025 Agenda

item.title: Vulnerability Data Enrichment for CVE Records: 246 CNAs on the Enrichment Recognition List for March 10, 2025
item.description: Vulnerability Data Enrichment for CVE Records: 246 CNAs on the Enrichment Recognition List for March 10, 2025blogBy CVE Program|March 11, 2025

item.title: GE Vernova CNA Has Replaced General Electric (Gas Power) CNA
item.description: GE Vernova CNA Has Replaced General Electric (Gas Power) CNAnewsMarch 11, 2025As of March 11, 2025, the General Electric (Gas Power)CVE Numbering Authority (CNA), which became a CVE Program partner in 2022, has been replaced by theGE VernovaCNA. The GE Vernova CNA’s scope is: “All GE Vernova products.”

item.title: Integrated DNA Technologies Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: Integrated DNA Technologies Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsMarch 11, 2025Integrated DNA Technologies, Inc.(IDT) is now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for vulnerabilities within IDT-manufactured products, software, and services that are in-service.

item.title: T-Mobile US Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)
item.description: T-Mobile US Added as CVE Numbering Authority (CNA)newsMarch 11, 2025T-Mobile USis now aCVE Numbering Authority (CNA)for all T-Mobile US products (including end-of-life/end-of-service products), as well as vulnerabilities in third-party software/hardware discovered by T-Mobile US that are not in another CNA’s scope.
